subject: Politics
title: Plato's Republic
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Plato's Republic.

hook.text: Plato wanted philosopher kings to rule. Democracy, he argued, was rule by the ignorant. He feared the mob.

buildup.text: In 'The Republic,' Plato imagined an ideal city ruled by wise guardians trained from birth to seek truth.

discovery.text: Plato's Allegory of the Cave shows people mistaking shadows for reality. Only philosophy reveals the truth.

twist.text: Plato's ideal state is totalitarian by modern standards. He banned poetry and controlled every aspect of life.

climax.text: Despite its flaws, Plato's question endures: should the wisest govern, or should everyone have an equal voice?

punchline.text: Plato distrusted democracy. His question still haunts it today.

quiz.question: Who did Plato believe should rule the ideal state?
options: Philosopher kings trained from birth to seek wisdom
